alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Southampton; Suffolk; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:48PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Hertford, northwestern Gates, Isle of Wight, southeastern Southampton, and southeastern York Counties, the City of Poquoson, the northwestern City of Chesapeake, the City of Franklin, the northwestern City of Portsmouth, the City of Suffolk, the City of Hampton and the City of Newport News through 130 PM EDT... At 1248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a broken line of strong thunderstorms extending from near Lee Hall to 6 miles south of Franklin. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Hampton, Franklin, Smithfield, Windsor, Langley AFB, Churchland, Sunbury, Hampton University, Christopher Newport University, Patrick Henry Field, Downtown Suffolk, Holland, Seaford, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Northampton and Gates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Southampton; Suffolk; York
